It has been shown that , under hypoxic conditions , activation of HIF-1alpha contributes to the Warburg effect through coordinated upregulation of glycolysis and downregulation of oxidative phosphorylation , both of which are mainly achieved by inducing expression of the following : ( 1 ) glucose transporters such as Glut1 to increase glucose uptake ( Iyer et al. , 1998 , Ryan et al. , 1998 , Wood et al. , 1998 ) , ( 2 ) glycolytic enzymes to accelerate flux from glucose to pyruvate ( Iyer et al. , 1998 ) , ( 3 ) pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase 1 ( PDK1 ) to inhibit the conversion of pyruvate to acetyl CoA ( Kim et al. , 2006 , Papandreou et al. , 2006 ) , and ( 4 ) lactate dehydrogenase A ( LDHA ) to promote pyruvate-to-lactate conversion ( Iyer et al. , 1998 , Ryan et al. , 1998 ) .

To validate this observation , we performed coimmunoprecipitation ( co-IP ) analyses in cells stably expressing either hemagglutinin ( HA )-FLAG-tagged wild-type ( WT ) FBXL5 or FBXL5-DeltaFbox , a dominant negative mutant of FBXL5 that is defective in Skp1 binding , rendering it unable to incorporate into an active SCFFBXL5 E3 ubiquitin ligase complex .

CIA Targeting Complex Is Not a Substrate of the FBXL5-E3 Ubiquitin Ligase Complex To examine the functional relevance of the FBXL5 , CIA , and targeting complex interaction , we tested the hypothesis that the CIA targeting complex was targeted by FBXL5 for ubiquitin dependent degradation in a relationship analogous to the FBXL5-IRP2 interaction .

In contrast to IRP2 , which is stabilized by and preferentially co-precipitates with FBXL5-DeltaFbox , the CIA targeting complex interacts equally well with both the Wt and mutant forms of FBXL5 , suggesting that the interaction may differ from the hypothesized E3-substrate relationship            .

The pattern for IRP1 expression appeared to behave similarly , although the effects were much weaker than was seen with IRP2 , raising questions regarding its potential significance                    .
